required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of an Intravenous Drug in Pediatric Patients With Acute Asthma (0476-301)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind Study Comparing the Clinical Effects of Intravenous Montelukast With Placebo in Pediatric Patients (Ages 6 to 14 Years) With Acute Asthma

brief_summary.textblock: This study will attempt to find out if the addition of an intravenous form of a drug that is already used for treating asthma in children will help resolve asthma attacks faster than using the current standard care alone.

detailed_description.textblock: The duration of treatment is a one time dose.

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in FEV1 (Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second) Over the First 60 Minutes After Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and (time weighted average over) 60 Minutes
primary_outcome.description: Improvement in FEV1 as the time-weighted average change from baseline over 60 minutes following the end of study drug administration. Time-weighted average of the changes from baseline obtained over the 60 minutes (at 60, 45, 30 and 15) with the time interval between any measurement and the measurement prior to it used as the weighting factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Modified Pulmonary Index [mPI] Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in modified pulmonary index [mPI] score assessed 60 minutes following the end of study drug administration. mPI questionnaire scores each component on a scale of 0 to 3 (low to high) with a total possible score of 12. The components are respiratory rate, wheezing, prolongation of expiration (Inspiratory:Expiratory ratio), and accessory muscle use.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Failure (Hospitalization or Time to Decision to Discharge > 2 Hours)
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment Failure is defined as a.) patients who required hospitalization, or b.) patients for whom a decision to discharge home has not been reached by 2 hours following the end of study drug administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time-Weighted Average Change in FEV1 Over 45 Minutes Following the End of Study Drug Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in FEV1 as time-weighted average change from baseline over 45 minutes following the end of study drug administration: Time-weighted average of the changes from baseline obtained over the 45 minutes (at 45, 30 and 15) with the time interval between any measurement and the measurement prior to it used as the weighting factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time-Weighted Average Change in FEV1 Over 30 Minutes Following the End of Study Drug Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in FEV1 as the time-weighted average change from baseline over 30 minutes following the end of study drug administration. Time-weighted average of the changes from baseline obtained over the 30 minutes (at 30 and 15) with the time interval between any measurement and the measurement prior to it used as the weighting factor.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in FEV1 After 15 Minutes Following the End of Study Drug Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Improvement in FEV1 as the time-weighted average change from baseline over the first 15 minutes following the end of study drug administration. Change = 15 minutes value minus Baseline value

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Dose of β-agonist Administered Per Patient Over a Period of 2 Hours Following the End of Study Drug Administration
secondary_outcome.description: Median total dose of β-agonist administered per patient over a period of 2 hours following the end of study drug administration.

intervention.description: Montelukast IV 5.25 mg lyophilized (reconstituted in 20 mL of 3.3% dextrose/0.3% sodium chloride) for a study approximately 120 minutes in duration
Pbo for a study approximately 120 minutes in duration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children 6-14 years of age seeking treatment in emergency departments with acute asthma attacks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other respiratory conditions (including congenital lung abnormalities) or other acute illnesses that would complicate current treatment and response for asthma

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Phase III World Wide (U.S., Europe, Asia, South America, and Lithuania) Multicenter Study. Study Start Date: July 2005 Primary Completion Date: March 2008 Study Completion Date: March 2008

measure.title: Baseline FEV 1 (L)
measure.description: Forced Expiratory Volume in one second, measured in Liters (FEV 1 (L)) A total of 4/276 (1—montelukast; 3—placebo) randomized patients were excluded from the Full Analysis Set (FAS) of the primary endpoint

measure.title: Baseline FEV1 (Percent predicted)
measure.description: Percent of predicted baseline Forced Expiratory Volume in one second (FEV1) A total of 4/276 (1—montelukast; 3—placebo) randomized patients were excluded from the Full Analysis Set (FAS) of the primary endpoint

outcome.title: Improvement in FEV1 (Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second) Over the First 60 Minutes After Administration
outcome.description: Improvement in FEV1 as the time-weighted average change from baseline over 60 minutes following the end of study drug administration. Time-weighted average of the changes from baseline obtained over the 60 minutes (at 60, 45, 30 and 15) with the time interval between any measurement and the measurement prior to it used as the weighting factor.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and (time weighted average over) 60 Minutes
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). The FAS population includes all randomized patients who received double-blind study drug, and with efficacy measurements both at baseline and at least one time point over the time interval considered.

measure.title: Improvement in FEV1 (Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second) Over the First 60 Minutes After Administration
measure.description: Improvement in FEV1 as the time-weighted average change from baseline over 60 minutes following the end of study drug administration. Time-weighted average of the changes from baseline obtained over the 60 minutes (at 60, 45, 30 and 15) with the time interval between any measurement and the measurement prior to it used as the weighting factor.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). The FAS population includes all randomized patients who received double-blind study drug, and with efficacy measurements both at baseline and at least one time point over the time interval considered.

analysis.method_desc: Model terms: treatment, region (US, non-US) and baseline FEV1 as covariate

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Modified Pulmonary Index [mPI] Score
outcome.description: Change from baseline in modified pulmonary index [mPI] score assessed 60 minutes following the end of study drug administration. mPI questionnaire scores each component on a scale of 0 to 3 (low to high) with a total possible score of 12. The components are respiratory rate, wheezing, prolongation of expiration (Inspiratory:Expiratory ratio), and accessory muscle use.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). The FAS population includes all randomized patients who received double-blind study drug, and with efficacy measurements both at baseline and at least one time point over the time interval considered.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Modified Pulmonary Index [mPI] Score
measure.description: Change from baseline in modified pulmonary index [mPI] score assessed 60 minutes following the end of study drug administration. mPI questionnaire scores each component on a scale of 0 to 3 (low to high) with a total possible score of 12. The components are respiratory rate, wheezing, prolongation of expiration (Inspiratory:Expiratory ratio), and accessory muscle use.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). The FAS population includes all randomized patients who received double-blind study drug, and with efficacy measurements both at baseline and at least one time point over the time interval considered.

analysis.method_desc: Model terms: treatment, region (US, non-US) and baseline FEV1 as covariate

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment Failure (Hospitalization or Time to Decision to Discharge > 2 Hours)
outcome.description: Treatment Failure is defined as a.) patients who required hospitalization, or b.) patients for whom a decision to discharge home has not been reached by 2 hours following the end of study drug administration.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). At least one post-randomization measurement obtained subsequent to at least one dose of study treatment was required for inclusion in the analysis of treatment failure endpoint. Baseline FEV1 measurement was also required to assess this endpoint since it was included in the model.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment Failure (Hospitalization or Time to Decision to Discharge > 2 Hours)
measure.description: Treatment Failure is defined as a.) patients who required hospitalization, or b.) patients for whom a decision to discharge home has not been reached by 2 hours following the end of study drug administration.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS). At least one post-randomization measurement obtained subsequent to at least one dose of study treatment was required for inclusion in the analysis of treatment failure endpoint. Baseline FEV1 measurement was also required to assess this endpoint since it was included in the model.

class.title: Decision to Discharge Home not Reached by 2 Hours

analysis.method_desc: Model terms: treatment and baseline FEV1 as covariate

outcome.title: Total Dose of β-agonist Administered Per Patient Over a Period of 2 Hours Following the End of Study Drug Administration
outcome.description: Median total dose of β-agonist administered per patient over a period of 2 hours following the end of study drug administration.
outcome.population: At least one post-randomization measurement obtained subsequent to at least one dose of study treatment was required for inclusion in the analysis of total doses of Beta-Agonist (mg) endpoint.

measure.title: Total Dose of β-agonist Administered Per Patient Over a Period of 2 Hours Following the End of Study Drug Administration
measure.description: Median total dose of β-agonist administered per patient over a period of 2 hours following the end of study drug administration.
measure.population: At least one post-randomization measurement obtained subsequent to at least one dose of study treatment was required for inclusion in the analysis of total doses of Beta-Agonist (mg) endpoint.

analysis.method_desc: ANCOVA model (Nonparametric) based on Tukey's normalized ranks with terms treatment, region (US, non-US) and baseline FEV1 as covariate

event.sub_title: Any Injury, Poisoning And Procedural Complications
Any Respiratory, Thoracic And Mediastinal Disorders
Any General Disorders And Administration Site Conditions
Any Musculoskeletal And Connective Tissue Disorders
Any Respiratory, Thoracic And Mediastinal Disorders
Any Skin And Subcutaneous Tissue Disorders

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
